task.title: Use Gmail to Write an Email

context.p: Gmail is a popular email service provided by Google. Follow the steps below to write an email using Gmail:

step.cmd: Open your web browser and go to the Gmail website.
Sign in to your Gmail account using your email address and password.
Once you are logged in, click on the "Compose" button located in the top-left corner of the Gmail interface. This will open a new email composition window.
In the "To" field, enter the email address of the recipient. You can also add multiple recipients by separating their email addresses with commas.
Next, enter a subject for your email in the "Subject" field. This will give the recipient an idea of what your email is about.
In the main body of the email, type your message. You can format the text using the formatting options available in the toolbar, such as bold, italic, underline, and more.

If you want to attach any files to your email, click on the "Attach files" icon (usually represented by a paperclip) in the toolbar. This will allow you to select files from your computer to attach to the email.

Once you have finished composing your email, you can select to send it immediately by clicking on the "Send" button. Alternatively, you can save it as a draft by clicking on the "Save draft" button. Saved drafts can be accessed later from the "Drafts" folder in your Gmail account.

If you want to add any additional options to your email, such as adding a signature, changing the font, or setting a priority, you can do so by clicking on the respective icons or options available in the toolbar.

Before sending the email, it's a good practice to review it for any errors or mistakes. You can do this by clicking on the "Preview" button, which will show you a preview of how your email will appear to the recipient.
Finally, when you are ready to send the email, click on the "Send" button. Gmail will send the email to the recipient(s) and display a confirmation message.
